lexUnit.name: pursue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: follow in order to catch or attack.

sentence.text: There was a lot of noise of men shouting and dogs barking , as the servants from the house pursued the robbers across the fields .
For all she knew , the pilot in the Spitfire pursuing his enemy low across the fields was Johnny , and if anyone were to die in that encounter , it must not be him .
With UN approval MacArthur pursued them across the parallel and on towards the Yalu River which marked the border with Communist China .
Trail of destruction … police pursue teenage joyrider across three counties .
She had defeated the Roman IX Legion at a bloody battle in the Godmanchester area ( Cambridgeshire ) and pursued the survivors along Ermine Street to their base at Lincoln .
Police pursued the car along the A345 to Bulford village where it crashed .
Miniature tin cars , beetle-bright in the sun , pursued each other busily along the roads .
The police car had pursued the Sierra along the road to Burton Salmon .

Six Broadstairs matrons attempting to shop at Marchesi 's the confectioners , two errand boys buying bloaters from Mr Goodman the fishmonger , a few afternoon revellers strolling out from the Dolphin Inn and an eager group from the Tourist Cycling Club staying at the Balmoral Bijou Hotel found themselves swept along with the crowd as they pursued their leaders down Harbour Street under the ancient York Gate ( which being without specific Dickensian associations hardly received a glance ) .
Folk will pursue you down the street crying , ` You forgot your Biro . "
They were too far away for her to recognise faces , but she could imagine John and Angela among them , unaware that they had been pursued all the way from Romania .
In one case in 1988 a Romanian border guard pursued a Romanian citizen into Hungarian territory and shot him .
` His men pursued them into the forest to the east , but then they lost them .
The boy walked beside him from the Post Office to Lipton 's , talking about the secret that was safe between them , pursuing him into the shop itself .

When he was in the dining room she would be in the dairy ; when he wandered out to look at the home fields she would be over the lake by Burtness Wood ; when he made his way to the wood she would retreat up the fell and it was pointless , he rightly guessed , as well as being too open to comment , to pursue her onto the tops .
Iki fishermen have pursued various quarries over the years .
They will not pursue the adventurers through the arch , so a well-organized and swift exit is indicated !
They had pursued it through the maze of backstreets until unaccountably losing it in a cul-de-sac .
Lord Aldington is determined to pursue me to the end .
They pursued the fugitives for about nine miles and then lit bonfires on the hill-tops to alert the local peasantry .
In the forest insectivores with non-sociable behaviour , the male pursues the female , courts her , and leads her to the nest he has built .
This Pharaoh Hound was originally bred to pursue game , such as rabbits .

Both players were standing outside the players ' lounge when three men ran past them into the building , for which they are believed to have produced entrance tickets , pursued by around 20 Rangers fans .
After a successful rescue the small party is relentlessly pursued by the Viet Cong , but they are airlifted to safety by helicopters of the Air Cavalry .
If one of your colleagues is being pursued by a policeman , in whatever disguise and for whatever reason , then naturally you do all in your power to obstruct him .
Her best is about the reaction to her public appearances : Every time Margi is on the television , she claims , she goes home to be pursued by her mother with buckets of holy water .
I think I 'd have a siege mentality if I was pursued relentlessly by a pack of slavering tabloid reporters baying for blood .
A TRAGEDY was narrowly averted yesterday when a car being pursued by police was in a head-on crash with a family on a day out .
Chasing prey through the tree-tops is much more hazardous than pursuing them along the ground , as this raccoon-hunting puma is discovering ( below ) .
Everywhere the English were now fleeing , singly and in groups , pursued by mosstroopers .
Clausewitz , distantly pursued by Mr Pick , thought war was always subordinate to political will .
Nymphs , when pursued by satyrs , have saved themselves by turning into trees .
He gambles that I will not leap down and pursue him along the pavement .
The gardener , Mrs Grindlewood-Gryke and I pursued him down the garden and into the bluebell wood .
Your voice pursued me down the marble stairway :
But I met a man on the road to the other village -- I 've pursued them over the mountain from Keswick and you know the road divides two ways -- and he swore they had come this way . "
The English fleet , once at sea , managed to cut across the bows of the Spaniards , then turned to pursue them up the channel .
At that moment Charlie spotted Tommy on his right flank pursuing two Germans up a hill .
